title: Calories in Grilled Shrimp
meta_description: Discover calories in grilled shrimp per 100g serving, including protein, fat, carbs, full nutrition breakdown, and preparation tweaks for better tracking.
assumptions: Peeled, medium shrimp, grilled without added oil, butter, or seasonings; dry heat cooking.
disclaimer: Nutrition varies by shrimp size, source, cooking method, and any added ingredients. Check labels or apps for specifics.

quick_answer.text: 100g of grilled shrimp provides about 99 kcal and 24g protein.

label_note: Values align with Nutrition Facts labels for straightforward comparison.

tweaks.label: Add 1 tsp olive oil for grilling per 100g
Marinated in garlic butter (1 tsp per 100g)

faqs.q: How many calories in 100g of grilled shrimp?
faqs.a: Approximately 99 kcal for plain grilled shrimp.

faqs.q: What's the protein content in grilled shrimp?
faqs.a: About 24g protein per 100g, making it a lean seafood option.

faqs.q: Do grilled shrimp have carbs or fat?
faqs.a: Very low: 0.2g carbs and 0.3g total fat per 100g.

faqs.q: How does grilling affect shrimp calories?
faqs.a: Grilling without oil keeps calories low; added fats increase them significantly.

faqs.q: Is cholesterol high in grilled shrimp?
faqs.a: Yes, about 161mg per 100g, mostly from natural shellfish content.
